Posts.Content: Sep 30, 2009 05:28PM Danusia wrote: You are all right... pain management is so important, I just hope that anyone who is preparing for surgery reads this thread so they can be prepared to ask about pain mgt so there is no question as to how this important piece will be handled . I had my mastectomy on September 9th, we had to be at the hospital for 6:45 am and I was operated at 8:00 am with MX to the left breast with TX.  At 2:00 pm the same day my son and daughter were ready to take me home and I was in such pain they told them to come back in ½ until the nurse could run morphine through the drip to hold me over enough to get me home.  Post-op my PS only prescribed 12 Darvocet and that was it... In hindsight, I feel that they should look at keeping mastectomy patients in at least overnight here in Ontario. Coulda, woulda, shoulda.... Hind-sight! Dana
